review_title: Run away as far as you can from this university
pros: It has a beautiful campus.
cons:
Spend your federal dollars and financial aid money elsewhere. 

This university is only cordial on the surface. This university talks about inclusion and diversity, but it only participates in it to obtain federal funding for its programs, but the university. and its faculty are racists. It got rid of its black university president in only 6 months because the strategic plans were too diverse and inclusive.

Several students from the Ph.D. program, Master's degree, and undergraduate programs complain about racism to the deans, and nothing is done about the racist comments and unfair practices of faculty members and staff. 

Do not believe anything in their marketing. It is all a big hoax to get your money/\\ DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE!!! RUN far away/\

cons: Small, rural area where the institution is located .

pros: Professional atmosphere for the most part with a willingness to be open with their employees. Being a young group of managers helped of course.

job_title: Learning Graduate Assistant in Tiffin, OH
pros: There is a great culture here, all the employees seem to get along with each other. Campus is small and easy to navigate.
cons: Campus is in the middle of nowhere and you have to take trips to do certain activities. People change offices very often, and campus is not completely accessible for people with disabilities.

job_title: Men's Assistant Golf Coach in Tiffin, OH
pros: Flexibility and Leadership Opportunities. The NCAA Division II Athletics field was a great experience learning how to mesh and lead other individuals within the working environment. The culture within the university itself was amazing! Great employee support and great leaders within each division.
cons: Takes time to handle situation with the compliance office because they don't have enough people on staff handling the Athletic Compliance needs.

pros: Convenient, decent pay, the classes are easy to teach and the accommodations at the different schools are quite nice and easy to access.
cons: The classes are few and far between. I haven't had a course to teach in over a year. Enrollment is down and the school seems to care more about making money than proper education.

job_title: Call Center Representative in Tiffin, OH
pros: Fun people to work with as the office is small.
cons: With any call center it can be tiring chasing empty leads. There are a lot of people that do not want to come to the school that you call and so you face a lot of rejection. Can get very boring at times to doing the same repetitive thing over and over.

review_title: Tiffin University has provided me great opportunties and allowed me to grow personally and professionally.

Benefits
You have a great deal of power in to get things approved/done in a timely fashion.

pros: There are a few good students.
cons: Tiffin creates an environment where students expect an A in every course, just for doing work regardless of whether the work deserves it.  Department Chair sided with students who complained they deserved higher grades.  No academic rigor expected.  Largely felt like a pay-for-degree university.  Pay is low but no real prep work required as courses are already designed.
